data.title: DAY TRIP: Carlsbad
data.meta_description: Eight miles north of Solana Beach is the coastal town of Carlsbad. A charming town with a European influence, this "Village by the Sea" is filled with excellent restaurants, diverse shopping centers, historical destinations and world famous attractions.
data.text:
Eight miles north of Stubbs is the coastal town of Carlsbad. A charming town with a European influence, this “Village by the Sea” is filled with excellent restaurants, diverse shopping centers, historical destinations and world famous attractions. If you’re looking to take a day trip, here’s a sample of some of the fun and educational things you can experience just up the coast.

K1 Speed

At K1 Speed Carlsbad, all ages can experience the thrill of head-to-head action! Perfect for families, friends and co-workers looking for something fun to do, Arrive & Drive racing allows individuals to come in anytime, without a reservation, and race in our high-performance all-electric karts.

Leo Carrillo Ranch

Leo Carrillo Historic Park, is a historic estate in Carlsbad, California. The rancho was built as a weekend retreat for actor Leo Carrillo (The Cisco Kid), who designed the property in the style of Spanish hacienda estates. If you’re visiting in the spring, the resident peacocks will be displaying their grand feathers in search of a mate. Walk around the beautiful grounds for a quick historical and educational trip.

Museum of Making Music

When you step into the galleries (and back in time) you’ll see outstanding examples of musical instruments, many of them displayed in vintage music store settings. You’ll also hear some familiar tunes in audio and video clips, have many hands-on opportunities to pick up and play a variety of instruments, and discover the innovative ways that the music industry has grown over the years. It’s an insider’s view of the world of making music.

Village Faire – Restaurants and Shops at Carlsbad Village

With its New England-style architecture with a Caribbean flare, this enclave of over 36 restaurants, shops and services surrounds a family friendly fountain courtyard, located just a block from the beach and train station.

There are numerous shops to purchase your beachy California souvenirs. Be sure to visit The Compass restaurant for lunch.

Legoland California is filled with more than 60 kid-powered, kid-tastic rides, shows and attractions all built for fun and geared for families with children between the ages of 2 and 12! Inside LEGOLAND, you can enter a world of knights and princesses to conquer the Dragon Coaster. Kids can drive their own cars at Driving School.

Legoland Water Park features more than seven slides, sandy beaches and the unique Build-A-Raft River plus Pirate Reef and LEGO Legends of CHIMA Water Park comprising 10 acres of water fun!

Sea Life Aquarium is your child’s first interactive guide to the life of the sea, combining active hands-on learning with fascinating educational talks and up close encounters with sea creatures including sharks, octopi and rays!
